summary: The document is an FBI record detailing communications about Gabriel 'Mannarino', a Pittsburgh hoodlum involved in gambling activities, including a raid on a casino in New Kensington. It captures Mannarino's political opinions, showing his disappointment with the Democratic Party and consideration of supporting Republican candidates. Despite his political shift, he maintained a positive view of President John F. Kennedy but held a negative opinion of Attorney General Robert Kennedy. The document underscores the FBI's surveillance of individuals linked to organized crime and their political leanings.
key_findings: The document records FBI communications regarding Gabriel 'Mannarino' and his involvement in gambling activities.
Mannarino expressed disappointment with the Democratic Party and considered supporting Republican candidates.
Despite his political disillusionment, Mannarino still regarded President John F. Kennedy positively but had a negative view of Attorney General Robert Kennedy.
The document highlights the FBI's monitoring of individuals with potential ties to organized crime and their political affiliations.
